intro: Canthium valetonianum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Canthium valetonianum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
